Broadway, south from West 160th Street and showing a declivity in this Washington Heights area. Note the central plana being utilined as

(2)
A view in the opposite direction from West 158th Street and
showing mainly the west side of this thoroughfare.
About 1914.
The Rio Theatre, shown in the left center of No. 2 and ocoupying that irregular block bounded by Fort Washington Ave., Broadway and West 160th Street has been completely aoduired by Cardinal Hayes, who formerly had only a half interest in this and others, from the relatives of the late John Whalen according to the New York Times of April 17, 1938. The other real estate involved is the easterly block front of Amsterdam Ave. between 154th and 155th Streets.

417674-a.title: The Georgia, southeast corner Broadway and 160th Street; Plan of first floor; Plan of upper floors.
